comments:
I wasn't sure if I should report a problem with a nightly, but given that eclipse-SDK-N20060310-0010-linux-gtk-x86_64 has the same issue, I thought that it may be useful. I tried the 32-bit version with a 32-bit vm and that did not exhibit the problem.

The 64 bit version with Sun's JDK 1.5.0_06 fails to start with a clean workspace. The error displayed is:

"An error has occurred. See the log file
/home/ijuma82/workspace/.metadata/.log."

The top of the .log file has:

java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: _pango_layout_set_auto_dir
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.gtk.OS._pango_layout_set_auto_dir(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.gtk.OS.pango_layout_set_auto_dir(OS.java:9034)

I'm also attaching the full log.

I tried running the N20060311-0010 build and it at least starts for me.  So the trigger seems to be a bit more complex than just starting eclipse.

That being said, the pango_layout_set_auto_dir native was added on March 7th, so it's very likely that the 64-bit library was not compiled until this week's integration build (March 11th).

Marking report as WORKSFORME; if you see this fail with the latest integration build or later then please reopen this report, thanks.

(In reply to comment #2)
> That being said, the pango_layout_set_auto_dir native was added on March 7th,
> so it's very likely that the 64-bit library was not compiled until this week's
> integration build (March 11th).

I believe this theory to be correct. Just tried the eclipse-SDK-I20060314-1200-linux-gtk-x86_64 and it works fine (and I can confirm that the ctrl-space crasher is also fixed). Thanks.
